dt: {bc}the denial, answer, or plea {dx_def}see {dxt|plea||2b}{/dx_def} of one against whom a criminal or civil action is brought {bc}a {d_link|defendant|defendant:1} 's denial, answer, or plea
{bc}ability to keep an opponent from scoring in a game or contest {bc}{d_link|defensive|defensive:1} play or ability
{bc}means or method of defending or protecting oneself, one's team, or another

dt.t: Big shells are an effective {wi}defense{/wi} against these predators as well.

dt: {bc}the collected facts and method adopted by a defendant to protect and defend against a plaintiff's action
{bc}a sequence of moves available to the second player in the opening {dx_def}see {dxt|opening||3a}{/dx_def}
{bc}a defending party or group (as in a court of law)

dt.t: He was the linchpin of one of the league's stoutest {wi}defenses{/wi} …

dt: {bc}the military and industrial {d_link|aggregate|aggregate:3} that authorizes and supervises {d_link|arms|arm:3} production

et: Middle English {it}defense, defence,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}defens, defense, defence,{/it} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}dēfensa, dēfensum{/it} (Late Latin {it}dēfensa{/it} "vengeance"), nominal derivatives from feminine and neuter of Latin {it}dēfensus,{/it} past participle of {it}dēfendere{/it} "to ward off, {et_link|defend|defend}"
shortdef: the act or action of defending
the denial, answer, or plea of one against whom a criminal or civil action is brought : a defendant 's denial, answer, or plea

dt: {bc}to take specific {d_link|defensive|defensive:1} action against (an opposing team or player or an offensive play) {bc}to attempt to keep (an opponent or play) from scoring in a game or contest

dt.t: The gangly Pressey was clearly Milwaukee's only real hope of {wi}defensing{/wi} Bird …

shortdef: to take specific defensive action against (an opposing team or player or an offensive play) : to attempt to keep (an opponent or play) from scoring in a game or contest

dt: {bc}an often unconscious mental process (such as repression) that makes possible compromise solutions to personal problems

shortdef: an often unconscious mental process (such as repression) that makes possible compromise solutions to personal problems
a defensive reaction by an organism

dt: {bc}the system of protective measures and emergency relief activities conducted by civilians in case of hostile attack, sabotage, or natural disaster

shortdef: the system of protective measures and emergency relief activities conducted by civilians in case of hostile attack, sabotage, or natural disaster

dt: {bc}a plea of justification for the use of force or for homicide
{bc}the act of defending oneself, one's property, or a close relative

shortdef: a plea of justification for the use of force or for homicide
the act of defending oneself, one's property, or a close relative

dt: {bc}a system of defense (as in basketball or football) in which each player guards an assigned area rather than a specified opponent

shortdef: a system of defense (as in basketball or football) in which each player guards an assigned area rather than a specified opponent

dt: {bc}to say that someone is right or good

dt.t: His friends quickly {it}came/jumped to his defense{/it}.

shortdef: to say that someone is right or good

dt: {bc}in order to keep (something) safe that is being physically attacked

dt.t: They fought {it}in defense of{/it} their country.

dt: {bc}in support of (someone or something) that is being verbally attacked or criticized

dt.t: She spoke out {it}in defense of{/it} justice.
Let me say, {it}in her defense{/it}, that I would have done the same thing that she did.
He spoke up {it}in his own defense{/it}.

shortdef: in order to keep (something) safe that is being physically attacked
in support of (someone or something) that is being verbally attacked or criticized

dt.t: If anyone criticizes her husband, she always {it}jumps to his defense{/it}.
